image.altText: A former politician talking to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Former South Australian premier Mike Rann has sharply criticised the gas industry and warned that "battalions" of fossil fuel lobbyists will be descending on next year's UN climate summit to influence negotiations.

title.children: 'Swarm' of fossil fuel lobbyists coming to COP31, former SA premier warns

image.altText: security cameras on a pole behind a fence with razor wire on top

props.synopsis: A South Australian court has heard that a correctional services executive was "motivated by financial greed" when he planned a $300,000 prison upgrade rort to fund his retirement.

title.children: 'Ambitious masterplan' led to $300k prison upgrade rort, court hears

image.altText: A blurred parking fine on the windscreen of a white car

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has won a four-year legal battle against an Adelaide council over a $104 parking fine.

title.children: SA woman wins $104 parking fine challenge after over $50k in legal costs

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: A teenage boy has been arrested after a woman was seriously injured in an alleged rape and assault in Adelaide's southern suburbs overnight.

title.children: Teen arrested after woman sleeping rough allegedly sexually assaulted

image.altText: Logos of the University of South Australia and University of Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Sporting clubs from the University of Adelaide and UniSA face an uncertain future in an amalgamation process that has pitted some clubs against each other in the race to be a part of the new institute.

title.children: Rival and traditional Adelaide sporting clubs under threat by university merger

image.altText: A side profile of Ms Hudson, with a minuture Qantas plane tail blurred in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has entered into an agreement with Qantas for a Product Innovation Centre that is expected to create more than 420 technology jobs by the end of 2028.

title.children: Hundreds of Qantas jobs to come to new innovation centre in Adelaide

image.altText: A vista along the River Murray.

props.synopsis: More water rights in the Murray-Darling Basin will be purchased from farmers and irrigators in a renewed push by the federal government to return 450 gigalitres of water to the environment.

title.children: Murray-Darling Basin stoush looms over more water buybacks

image.altText: close up of sanjeev gupta in glasses

props.synopsis: Sanjeev Gupta is gone from the Whyalla steelworks but his troubles are far from over, with a former high-level international executive who oversaw the South Australian operation now suing for US $30 million in unpaid wages and bonuses.

title.children: Sanjeev Gupta accused of deliberately losing phones in unpaid wages case

image.altText: Smiling man with dog and takeaway coffee

props.synopsis: Despite assistance dog Max wearing a vest and Garth Murray carrying his accreditation, they still faced illegal discrimination on a round-Australia charity walk, with one publican even calling the police on them.

title.children: Country pub calls cops on army vet and his assistance dog

image.altText: SA Police generic

props.synopsis: Police said a man was struck by a car on Hillier Road, Hillier, just before 8pm on Tuesday before he was rushed to the hospital where he later died.

title.children: Woman charged over fatal alleged hit-run crash in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A guitarists' face is hidden behind a mess of hair as he headbangs.

props.synopsis: Heavy metal band KNAW dream of playing festivals one day. The problem is they are the only band of their kind around for hundreds of kilometres.

title.children: Heavy metal band embarks on 16-hour round trip for 40-minute gig

image.altText: Columns of building with branches

props.synopsis: A new push to change South Australia's abortion laws to limit terminations after 23 weeks has been voted down in state parliament's Upper House.

title.children: Abortion legislation voted down in South Australian Parliament

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: Children and young people at Adelaide's only youth detention centre are being held to the floor in a restraint technique that "may constitute a breach of human rights and clinical best practice", according to a report tabled in parliament.

title.children: Report reveals SA youth detainees 'routinely' physically restrained

image.altText: People standing in a group wearing T-shirts that say "drink more, die younger".

props.synopsis: The Coonawarra Vignerons, in South Australia's South East, has deleted a post which attracted controversy for celebrating binge drinking.

title.children: Wine body sorry for 'disappointing' T-shirts bearing 'irresponsible' messaging

image.altText: A woman in a dark blazer sits in a room in front of a bannister and the window blinds are down

props.synopsis: Andrea Foster and her son Peter Spiniello continue to feel let down by a system they believe caused the death of their daughter, and sister, who was killed seven years ago by a mentally unwell man.

title.children: Family of woman killed by mentally unwell man says her death was 'preventable'

image.altText: A possum-skin quilt built from squares etched with messages about the promise of the treaty process.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of treaties exist between First Nations people and governments around the world. One state in Australia just became one of them.

title.children: Will Victoria's new First Nations treaty be the first of many?

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: Around 60 men attended a protest at NSW parliament organised by the Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network on Saturday. Without masks, it gave the ABC the opportunity to identify some of them.

title.children: Civil engineer identified among those who attended Neo-Nazi protest

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing over a rural highway

props.synopsis: Peak severe weather season is arriving, and an influx of tropical moisture will fuel thunderstorms in all Australian states and territories between Friday and Sunday.

title.children: Supercell risk as 72-hour storm outbreak to light up skies

image.altText: An empty mail box.

props.synopsis: The average first-time home buyer in the US is older than ever, but a new proposal could leave them paying off a mortgage until old age.

title.children: Trump has floated the idea of a 50-year mortgage. Here's how it could work — or not

image.altText: Boats loaded onboard a large ship.

props.synopsis: An Australian Border Force vessel has docked in Broome carrying four fishing boats, prompting anger from the fishing industry over a government scheme that gives illegal fishers boats to return home in.

title.children: Growing evidence of secret taxpayer-funded boats for illegal foreign fishers

image.altText: Two happy dogs, one large and one small, on a beach.

props.synopsis: The huge range of dog breeds that exists today is often thought of as a modern phenomenon, but new research suggests this vast diversity started thousands of years ago.

title.children: Different 'breeds' of dog started emerging more than 10,000 years ago

image.altText: A man's hand holds large blueberries.

props.synopsis: New rules around a popular insecticide could lead to lower blueberry production, but growers are confident the industry will adapt.

title.children: Insecticide suspension could have 'massive impact' on blueberry crops

image.altText: A domed mosque overlooking a valley, with charred window frames from an extinguished fire.

props.synopsis: Settler violence against Palestinian communities in the West Bank has been on the rise in recent years.

title.children: Israeli settlers torch mosque in West Bank and scrawl hateful messages

image.altText: CCTV footage of a retail assault

props.synopsis: New offences for people assaulting or threatening service workers are expected to be introduced in time for the Christmas shopping rush.

title.children: Retail and hospitality workers to be protected under new Victorian laws

image.altText: A woman with dark curly hair smiles.

props.synopsis: The psychiatrist who pioneered the country's first gaming disorder clinic at a public hospital has been named the 2026 Australian of the Year for WA.

title.children: Gaming addiction treatment pioneer named Australian of the Year for WA

image.altText: french president emmanuel macron stands in between his wife and other officials at bataclan memorial

props.synopsis: The attacks were the deadliest on French soil since World War Two, scarring the national psyche and prompting emergency security measures, many of which are now embedded in law.

title.children: France honours victims of deadly Paris attacks 10 years on

image.altText: A young girl placing a pink-coloured, gel sheet mask over her face

props.synopsis: A new skincare line for children by actress-turned-entrepreneur Shay Mitchell creates an online uproar, with many questioning the need for the products.

title.children: Actor's skincare brand for children labelled 'dystopian' and 'tone deaf'

image.altText: China and Taiwan flags GOOD GENERIC

props.synopsis: The pair are accused of spreading "anti-China" content after releasing a documentary last year, which detailed Beijing's attempts at using influencers to court public support for unification.

title.children: Chinese police offer cash reward for arrest of Taiwanese influencers

image.altText: A person crouches next to a graffiti artwork of a smiling character, their face is hidden.

props.synopsis: Ever noticed the hundreds of smiley faces graffitied on buildings, the back of road signs, guardrails and bridges around Tasmania? The artist says the world needs more joy.

title.children: These 'silly, lighthearted' smiley tags show up all over Tasmania. This is who spray-paints them

image.altText: A former politician talking to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Former South Australian premier Mike Rann has sharply criticised the gas industry and warned that "battalions" of fossil fuel lobbyists will be descending on next year's UN climate summit to influence negotiations.

title.children: 'Swarm' of fossil fuel lobbyists coming to COP31, former SA premier warns

image.altText: An older woman and a middle-aged man — Nancy Pelosi and Leonardo DiCaprio — wear formal dress as they sit in a cathedral.

props.synopsis: The groundbreaking primatologist, who died in October, has been farewelled at a service in Washington, DC.

title.children: Jane Goodall farewelled, Leonardo DiCaprio among mourners

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: Former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh is charged with the 24-year-old's 2018 death in Far North Queensland. The jury has today been shown photos of her partner Marco Heidenreich's activities on the afternoon she died.

title.children: Photos of Toyah Cordingley's boyfriend on day of her death not manipulated, court told

image.altText: Pedestrians cross at Flinders Street

props.synopsis: The unemployment rate fell to 4.3 per cent in October, down from 4.5 per cent in September, as the number of people in employment increased by 42,200.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate slips to 4.3 per cent

image.altText: A female medical specialist in an office with a female patient

props.synopsis: Some Australians are waiting more than six years to see health specialists, prompting doctors to warn that people are risking death while languishing on public waiting lists.

title.children: 'I've had to literally fight': Aussies waiting more than six years for specialist appointments

image.altText: A man in black with a black hat holds a closed fist in the air as he sings into a microphone on a stage under lights.

props.synopsis: Rock royalty AC/DC power up the earthshaking riffs at the MCG, rattling Melbourne with low-level seismic recordings.

title.children: Melbourne thunderstruck as AC/DC rocks earthquake monitors
